benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Retrieve the full catalog as XML

covered: Core acceptance criteria: endpoint availability and successful retrievals for latest, requestedDate, accountId, and their combination are tested with assertions for 200, Content-Type: text/xml, and valid XML body.
XML correctness and contract: tests include well formed XML checks, a regression scenario for malformed XML, and backward compatibility checks against expected schema.
Error handling: scenarios cover no catalog, requestedDate not matching any version, invalid requestedDate format, invalid accountId format, and malicious input handling.
Authorization and authentication: missing token (401) and insufficient permissions (403) scenarios are included.
Service resilience: service unavailable (503), timeout (504), and transient network retry behaviour are covered.
Performance and concurrency: very large catalog, concurrent requests, peak load and response time checks are present.
Edge cases: empty catalog returning a valid empty XML structure, extra unsupported query parameters, and maximum parameter length checks are present.
Content type header: response Content-Type asserted as text/xml in success scenarios.
gaps: Caching and conditional requests: no tests for ETag, Cache-Control, If-None-Match or 304 Not Modified behavior.
Rate limiting and throttling: no tests for burst traffic, 429 responses, or Retry-After header behaviour.

Pagination or streaming for large responses: no tests for pagination or server behaviour when dataset is massive; if API does not support pagination this should be explicit and tested for large payload handling.
Accept header and content negotiation: no tests validating Accept header handling (application/xml vs text/xml) or 406 Not Acceptable responses.
AccountId existence and tenant feature toggles: missing tests for a correctly formatted but non-existent accountId and for behavior when tenant-specific catalog features are disabled.
Precise error code mapping: several scenarios accept multiple status codes (e.g., 400 or 404 or 422). Tests should assert the exact expected status code per API contract to avoid ambiguity.
Response headers and encoding: charset (utf-8), Content-Length, Content-Encoding (gzip) and other header-level validations are not covered.
Accessibility UI tests (screen reader and WCAG) are included but are out of scope for this API story and should be moved or re-scoped to a UI/portal story.
recommendations: Add caching tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers, implement conditional GET tests using If-None-Match and assert 304 Not Modified when appropriate.
Add rate limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to verify 429 responses and Retry-After header handling, and document expected throttling policy.

Clarify and test pagination or streaming strategy: if pagination is supported add tests for page boundaries and limits; if not supported, add tests and documentation for handling very large responses and memory/timeout behaviour.
Add Accept header tests and content negotiation cases, including asserted behaviour when unsupported media types are requested (406).
Add tests for valid-but-nonexistent accountId and for toggles where tenant-specific catalog features are disabled to assert the expected deterministic behaviour.
Tighten error assertions: replace tests that allow multiple codes with explicit expected status codes per documented API contract for each error condition.
Add header and encoding checks: validate charset, Content-Length, Content-Encoding (gzip), and any compression behaviour.
Include XSD/schema validation in automated tests to ensure XML conforms exactly to contract and include contract tests for backward compatibility.
Move or remove accessibility scenarios from this API feature and create separate UI accessibility stories with appropriate acceptance criteria.
Extend negative and chaos tests: simulate dependent service failures and partial failures under load to verify graceful degradation, monitoring signals, and correct error codes.
